summary: This is an email chain from July 2020 discussing a request from victims' attorneys for victim notification letters from the FBI to assist with applications to the victim compensation fund. The email highlights internal deliberation about the wording of such letters, as not all interviewed individuals may qualify as victims of a federal crime, despite being negatively affected by Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The central figure whose crimes are the subject of the victim notification request; individuals are identified as victims of his actions.

events.title: Request for Victim Notification Letters
events.description: Victims' attorneys request formal victim notification letters from the FBI for individuals interviewed, to assist with applications to the victim compensation fund.

events.title: Scheduled Call to Discuss Victim Letters
events.description: A phone call is scheduled for the afternoon of Tuesday, July 28, 2020, to discuss how to respond to the request for victim notification letters, specifically the wording challenges.

keyFacts: Victims' attorneys requested formal FBI victim notification letters to help victims apply for the victim compensation fund.
The FBI initially declined to provide FD-302 interview forms due to the active investigation.
Internal discussion revealed a challenge: not all individuals interviewed were necessarily victims of a federal crime, complicating the standard letter wording.
The task force aimed to assist everyone negatively affected by Jeffrey Epstein despite the legal technicalities.
A call was scheduled for the following week to finalize the response to the victims' attorneys.
